West Bengal is one of 29 states in India and is neighbored by the states of Jharkhand, Bihar, Odisha, Sikkim, and Assam. It is located in the east of India and also shares international borders with Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Nepal, where the Bay of Bengal encompasses the state from the south.^[Encyclopedia Britannica. 2020. https://www.britannica.com/place/West-Bengal] West Bengal has a functioning state government operating under the federal government system of India.^[Encyclopedia Britannica. 2020. https://www.britannica.com/place/West-Bengal/Economy#ref281404] The present state government control is in the hand of the All India Trinamool Congress, headed by Chief Minister of West Bengal Mamata Banerjee.^[Bhattacharya, Snigdhendu. July 21st, 2020. The Wire India. https://thewire.in/politics/mamata-banerjee-trinamool-congress-martyrs-day-2021-polls-speech-bjp] West Bengal’s first Coronavirus (COVID-19) patient was confirmed on March 17th, with the first COVID-19 death recorded on March 23rd.^[The Economic Times. March 18th, 2020. https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/west-bengal-reports-first-positive-case-of-coronavirus/articleshow/74680463.cms] ^[Singh, Shiv Sahay. March 23rd, 2020. The Hindu. https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/coronavirus-west-bengal-records-first-covid-19-death/article31143240.ece] 

West Bengal’s policies to contain COVID-19 date back to early March, where mass awareness campaigns started in schools on March 4th.^[The Print. March 4th, 2020. https://theprint.in/india/west-bengal-govt-asks-schools-to-sensitise-students-on-reducing-risk-of-coronavirus/375828/]  Within the first half of March, the state government had rushed to prepare hospitals and other medical installments to respond to the pandemic.^[Government of West Bengal. March 12th, 2020. https://www.wbhealth.gov.in/uploaded_files/corona/Bulletin_West_Bengal_12.03_.2020_.pdf] Restrictions on mass gathering started in the state with the restriction imposed on all sporting events from March 13th until 31st.^[Deccan Herald. March 14th, 2020. https://www.deccanherald.com/national/east-and-northeast/all-sports-events-in-bengal-postponed-till-march-30-west-bengal-cm-mamata-813663.html]  West Bengal’s major pandemic preparation started on March 16th when it invoked the century-old *Epidemic Diseases Act 1897*.^[The First Post. March 17th, 2020. https://www.firstpost.com/india/coronavirus-outbreak-mamata-banerjee-invokes-epidemic-diseases-act-in-west-bengal-asks-people-to-not-hide-covid-19-symptoms-8159571.html] Also on March 16th, West Bengal closed movie theaters until March 31st, and also closed tourist spots for 15 days.^[Dainik Statesman. March 17th, 2020. https://epaper.thestatesman.com/2597258/Dainik-Statesman/17TH-MARCH-2020#page/1/2] ^[Dainik Statesman. March 17th, 2020. https://epaper.thestatesman.com/2597258/Dainik-Statesman/17TH-MARCH-2020#issue/3/1]

On March 14th, the authorities announced that all educational institutions in the state would remain shut from March 15th to 31st.^[Singh, Shiv Sahay. March 14th, 2020. The Hindu. https://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/kolkata/coronavirus-west-bengal-government-closes-all-educational-institutions-till-march-31/article31068116.ece]  However, on March 16th, the state government very quickly extended the closure of educational institutions until April 15th.^[The New Indian Express. March 16th, 2020. https://www.newindianexpress.com/nation/2020/mar/16/bengal-shuts-down-schools-till-april-15-earmarks-rs-200-crore-to-combat-covid-19-2117438.html] Subsequently, the school closure was announced to extend until June 10th, then June 30th and July 31st by the end of June.^[India Today. April 11th, 2020. https://www.indiatoday.in/education-today/news/story/west-bengal-schools-and-colleges-closed-till-june-10-lockdown-extended-1665919-2020-04-11] ^[The Times of India. May 27th, 2020. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/education/news/schools-in-west-bengal-to-remain-closed-till-june-30/articleshow/76038886.cms] ^[India TV News. June 23rd, 2020. https://www.indiatvnews.com/education/news-west-bengal-schools-colleges-remain-closed-till-july-31-kolkata-covid-cases-628572] On April 2nd, the West Bengal government announced that students from Grade 1 to 8 would progress to the next grade without having to pass the respective exam.^[The Indian Express. April 2nd, 2020. https://indianexpress.com/article/education/coronavirus-west-bengal-to-promote-students-of-classes-1-to-8-without-exams-6343946/] 

On March 22nd, West Bengal imposed its first set of lockdown from March 23rd to 27th.^[The Hindustan Times. March 22nd, 2020. https://www.hindustantimes.com/kolkata/bengal-announces-complete-lockdown-from-monday-evening-till-march-27/story-cmPrLLAjzk72e6Y4NFNjEM.html] The state on March 21st suspended all inbound and outbound interstate bus services from midnight on March 21st until 31st.^[Government of West Bengal. March 21st, 2020. https://wb.gov.in/upload/MCLNEWS-200323112335837.pdf] The state authority also banned movement of all non-essential cargo from March 22nd to 31st.^[Government of West Bengal. March 22nd, 2020. https://wb.gov.in/upload/MCLNEWS-200323112038277.pdf] As part of statewide restrictions, on March 21st, it was announced that all social gatherings would be banned from March 22nd until 31st.^[Government of West Bengal. March 21st, 2020. https://wb.gov.in/upload/MCLNEWS-200323113538444.pdf] Shortly after, the state announced on March 24th that it would extended its lockdown until March 31st.^[The Economic Times. March 24th, 2020. https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/entire-west-bengal-brought-under-lockdown-till-march-31/articleshow/74792486.cms] This state lockdown was extended until April 30th, then to May 31st, then to June 15th and then until June 30th.^[Zee News. April 11th, 2020. https://zeenews.india.com/west-bengal/west-bengal-extends-coronavirus-covid-19-lockdown-till-april-30-schools-colleges-to-remain-shut-till-june-10-2275659.html] ^[The Times of India. May 18th, 2020. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/west-bengal-extends-lockdown-till-may-31-mamata-announces-slew-of-relaxations/articleshow/75806297.cms] ^[The Indian Express. May 31st, 2020. https://indianexpress.com/article/india/lockdown-till-june-15-in-west-bengal-malls-restaurants-to-reopen-june-8-6435167/] ^[The Economic Times. June 8th, 2020. https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/lockdown-extended-in-west-bengal-till-june-30-mamata-banerjee/articleshow/76263701.cms] On June 24th, the lockdown was extended to July 31st.^[The Statesman. June 24th, 2020. https://www.thestatesman.com/bengal/west-bengal-extends-lockdown-till-july-31-1502903363.html] While lockdown in non-containment zones progressed with state-mandated relaxations,^[The Economic Times. June 26th, 2020. https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/mamata-orders-extension-of-lockdown-in-west-bengal-till-july-31/articleshow/76644973.cms] lockdown in containment zones were strictly maintained.^[Singh, Shiv Sahay. June 9th, 2020. The Hindu. https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/other-states/lockdown-in-containment-zones-to-continue-till-june-30-in-west-bengal/article31782873.ece] Alongside lockdowns and relaxations, West Bengal decided to resume public transportation from May 27th with capacity restrictions.^[All India Radio. May 27th, 2020. http://www.newsonair.com/News?title=Inter-District-Government-bus-services-begins-in-West-Bengal&id=389745]  Television and film shootings were allowed from May 21st.^[Times of India. May 19th, 2020. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/bengali/tv-and-film-shoot-in-west-bengal-to-resume-from-may-21-in-clean-areas-with-safety-measures/articleshow/75819043.cms] Hawker shops and parlors were allowed to open from May 27th and interstate buses were allowed from May 21st.^[Mishra, Anupam. May 18th, 2020. India TV News. https://www.indiatvnews.com/news/india/west-bengal-hawkers-market-may-27-inter-district-buses-may-21-618354] All public and private offices were also allowed to open from June 8th.^[Singh, Shiv Sahay. May 30th, 2020. The Hindu. https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/other-states/coronavirus-lockdown-govt-private-offices-in-bengal-to-open-from-june-8-says-mamata/article31706536.ece]

Kolkata Municipality was quick to launch their own COVID-19 policies. The Municipality launched call center for COVID-19 awareness on March 16th, launched a separate control room and formed a dedicated medical response team on March 18th.^[The Kolkata Municipality Corporation. March 18th, 2020. https://www.kmcgov.in/KMCPortal/downloads/MC_Circular188_21_03_2020.pdf] ^[The Kolkata Municipality Corporation. March 18th, 2020. https://www.kmcgov.in/KMCPortal/downloads/MC_Circular189_21_03_2020.pdf] ^[The Kolkata Municipality Corporation. March 17th, 2020. https://www.kmcgov.in/KMCPortal/downloads/MC_Circular187_21_03_2020.pdf] The other municipalities and city bodies, including the Kolkata Municipality, started sanitations drives from April.^[Siliguri Times. May 12th, 2020. https://siliguritimes.com/hill-cart-road-vyavasayi-samiti-and-smc-jointly-sanitized-the-shops-and-footpaths-amid-pandemic/] ^[The New Indian Express. April 12th, 2020. https://www.newindianexpress.com/nation/2020/apr/12/covid--19-kolkata-municipal-corporation-conducts-disinfection-drive-2129147.html] ^[The Times of India. April 4th, 2020. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/sanitization-drive-in-salt-lake-to-combat-corona/articleshow/74975029.cms] Also on May 13th, the Kolkata Municipality launched their own quarantine centers.^[Nandi, Soumitra. May 14th, 2020. Millennium Post. http://www.millenniumpost.in/kolkata/municipal-corporation-sets-up-quarantine-centres-across-city-408788] Other public service bodies like Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation stopped their services from March 23rd until 31st.^[The Hindustan Times. March 22nd, 2020. https://www.hindustantimes.com/kolkata/no-metro-rail-services-in-kolkata-till-march-31/story-8gQBtip0tuaYyDHhn6Rp8H.htm] As the pandemic first hit the state, the West Bengal government set up temporary quarantine centers in stadiums.^[The Bridge. March 24th, 2020. https://thebridge.in/latest/coronavirus-how-sports-stadium-howrah-converted-quarantine-centre-overnight/]  

Faced with the challenges of rumors and fake news, on March 18th, the West Bengal government announced strict actions against spreading rumors about COVID-19.^[The Telegraph Online. March 18th, 2020. https://www.telegraphindia.com/west-bengal/coronavirus-in-west-bengal-kolkata-police-warns-rumour-mongers-of-stern-action/cid/1755432] The Chief Minister reiterated a stern warning against posting fake videos about COVID-19 on March 27th.^[Banerjee, Mamata. March 27th, 2020. Business Standard. https://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/mamata-warns-of-action-against-those-posting-fake-news-on-coronavirus-120032701694_1.html ] From the beginning of April, the West Bengal Police started singing versions of popular Bengali songs to raise awareness and motivate people.^[Nandini, Navashree. April 3rd, 2020. Republic World. https://www.republicworld.com/india-news/general-news/kolkata-police-sings-popular-bengali-song-giving-covid-awareness-twist.html] The West Bengal Police also played the Chief Minister’s “Awareness Song” about COVID-19 on the birth anniversary of famous Bengali poet, Rabindranath Tagore, on May 8th.^[Arnimesh, Shanker and Das, Madhuparna. May 8th, 2020. The Print. https://theprint.in/politics/police-issue-order-to-play-mamatas-covid-song-on-tagore-birthday-bjp-calls-it-insulting/417231/] On April 13th, the authorities commenced using drones to detect violations of social distancing rules in Kolkata’s New Town.^[Chakraborty, Ajanta. April 19th, 2020. The Times of India. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/authorities-use-drones-to-disperse-crowd-at-new-town-markets-in-kolkata/articleshow/75230277.cms] From April 12th, the Kolkata Police also resorted to drones to monitor the people and prevent mass gatherings.^[Business Standard. April 13th, 2020. https://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/kolkata-police-deploys-drones-to-track-lockdown-violators-120041300650_1.html]  

West Bengal launched a contact-tracing app named “Sandhane” on April 9th.^[Sarkar, Pranesh. April 9th, 2020. The Telegraph Online. https://www.telegraphindia.com/west-bengal/bengal-government-launches-app-to-track-coronavirus-cases/cid/1763627] On April 12th, the authorities announced mandatory mask-wearing in the state,^[Zee News. April 12th, 2020. https://zeenews.india.com/india/west-bengal-makes-wearing-mask-mandatory-in-public-places-2275963.html] which was also strictly applied to government officers and employees who started working in office from June 8th.^[The New Indian Express. June 10th, 2020. https://www.newindianexpress.com/nation/2020/jun/10/not-wearing-masks-in-office-will-be-seriously-viewed-west-bengal-government-to-staff-2154507.html] Furthermore, the authorities issued a mandatory mask regulation for the patients and relatives visiting hospitals on April 14th.^[Deccan Herald. April 15th, 2020. https://www.deccanherald.com/national/west-bengal-govt-makes-wearing-masks-compulsory-for-patients-relatives-when-visiting-hospitals-825672.html] The state government on July 4th stated that the violation of mask mandate would result into penal actions.^[The Statesman. July 4th, 2020. https://www.thestatesman.com/bengal/masks-now-mandatory-public-places-govt-1502905892.html] On April 13th, West Bengal decided to conduct a door-to-door survey of suspected COVID-19 patients in the high risk spots.^[Thakur, Joydeep. April 14th, 2020. The Hindustan Times. https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/covid-19-bengal-govt-to-start-door-to-door-survey-to-track-suspected-patients-in-high-risk-spots/story-iZSaty53U7nyU2iVaznP5L.html] Again on April 18th, West Bengal government announced “pool testing” to detect asymptomatic carriers.^[The Statesman. April 20th, 2020. https://www.thestatesman.com/bengal/west-bengal-health-department-set-to-start-pool-test-procedure-1502879282.html] From April 20th, the state started conducting rapid testing with the help of its 14 medical colleges.^[Yengkhom, Sumati. April 20th, 2020. The Times of India. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/state-to-start-rapid-testing-from-today/articleshow/75239940.cms] Despite these actions, the testing number in the state remains low compared to other states.^[Chatterji, Saubhadra. May 9th, 2020. The Hindustan Times. https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/centre-says-bengal-not-testing-enough-mismanaging-cases/story-Em6pDNsRr3S8WYvPGCrnCJ.html] Experts pointed out social stigma as one of contributing factor of low testing, which has resulted in higher death rates in the state.^[The Economic Times. May 8th, 2020. https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/social-stigma-low-testing-behind-west-bengals-high-covid-19-mortality-rate-say-experts/articleshow/75620079.cms] However after criticism of the government soared, West Bengal ramped up the testing number.^[Thakur, Joydeep. May 8th, 2020. The Hindustan Times. https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/increased-10-times-bengal-after-criticism-over-low-covid-19-tests/story-WxhgLuaSnpVUpeYm1ijdCO.html] Adding to mismanagement, despite identifying seven COVID-19 hotspots in the state by April 7th, the authorities took an unreasonably long time to finalize and announce containment zones in these hotspots.^[Sarkar, Niladry. April 18th, 2020. The Statesman. https://www.thestatesman.com/india/west-bengal-govt-yet-to-implement-strong-ground-level-action-in-4-covid-19-hotspot-districts-1502878522.html] ^[The Economic Times. April 10th, 2020. https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/seven-covid-19-hotspots-identified-in-bengal-mamata/articleshow/75031049.cms]  

West Bengal’s rapid testing policy in April took a hit within seven days when the Indian Council of Medical Research suggested halting the use of Chinese rapid test kits on April 27th.^[Dey, Sushmi. April 28th, 2020. The Times of India. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/icmr-tells-states-to-stop-using-rapid-tests-return-kits/articleshow/75417791.cms] On May 16th, West Bengal along with Council of Industrial and Scientific Research launched a clinical trial of convalescent plasma therapy which was finally approved from medical use on May 28th.^[Outlook India. May 28th, 2020. https://www.outlookindia.com/newsscroll/covid19-bengal-to-start-plasma-therapy-blood-component-collected-from-first-donor/1849174] ^[India TV News. May 16th, 2020. https://www.indiatvnews.com/news/india/covid-19-plasma-therapy-clinical-trial-kolkata-617754] In June, Kolkata Municipality introduced two major COVID-19 testing policies on June 11th and 16th respectively. The first policy involved conducting random COVID-19 testing in high rises and residential areas to control the infection.^[Times Now News. June 14th, 2020. https://www.timesnownews.com/kolkata/article/kolkata-municipal-corporation-begins-random-covid-19-testing-at-residential-complexes/606161]  The second one was to start IgG antibody tests to detect community transmission in the worst-hit areas.^[Deccan Herald. June 16th, 2020. https://www.deccanherald.com/national/east-and-northeast/antibody-tests-in-kolkata-to-check-for-community-spread-of-coronavirus-850384.html] Also on June 11th, Kolkata Municipality Corporation and the Kolkata police launched a joint effort to identify vulnerable senior citizens in residential areas.^[Ghosh, Dwaipayan. June 12th, 2020. Times of India. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/kmc-cops-form-team-for-high-rise-visits/articleshow/76329109.cms]

Early into the pandemic on March 20th, West Bengal announced food rations for the state’s 75 million people over six months in response to the economic realities of the situation.^[The Daily Star. March 20th, 2020. https://www.thedailystar.net/coronavirus-deadly-new-threat/news/free-food-grains-75cr-people-west-bengal-6-months-mamata-1883506] On March 19th, the authorities announced insurance of five hundred thousand rupees for each of the 1 million state health workers.^[Business Standard. March 19th, 2020. https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ani/covid-19-wb-to-provide-rs-5-lakh-insurance-each-to-government-medical-staff-120031901421_1.html] The insurance amount was doubled on March 30th.^[Outlook India. March 30th, 2020. https://www.outlookindia.com/newsscroll/medical-insurance-for-10-lakh-bengal-medical-personnel-doubled/1785281] On June 17th, West Bengal decided to honor medical workers through the “COVID warrior” designation and awarding COVID warriors with a 10 percent incentive.^[Konar, Debashis. March 25th, 2020. https://www.deccanherald.com/national/east-and-northeast/west-bengal-converts-state-run-hospital-into-covid-19-isolation-treatment-facility-817439.html] West Bengal also launched COVID warrior clubs for COVID-19 survivors in all the districts, which involved the government providing shelter and basic necessities to these socially stigmatized survivors.^[Thakur, Joydeep. June 29th, 2020. The Hindustan Times. https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/bengal-govt-starts-covid-19-warrior-club-comprising-recovered-patients-in-bid-to-contain-pandemic/story-7hW3YebgybWO0A2nn4BgjP.html] 

One of West Bengal’s first restrictions on government services was to limit the number of hours of the work duty period. On March 19th, West Bengal government curtailed the duty period by one hour.^[The Times of India. March 19th, 2020. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/state-employees-office-time-cut-short-by-an-hour/articleshow/74700590.cms] On the following day, March 20th, the state government initiated a partial work-from-home policy until March 31st for the state employees, regulating that 50 percent of employees need to work remotely.^[The Times of India. March 21st, 2020. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/work-from-home-for-govt-staff-free-ration-for-7-9cr-poor-in-state/articleshow/74740241.cms] On March 23rd after the state lockdown started,  banking hours were shortened between 10am to 2pm.^[Outlook India. March 23rd, 2020. https://www.outlookindia.com/newsscroll/covid19-banks-in-bengal-to-transact-till-2-pm/1777483]  From March 19th, the Kolkata High Court decided to defer “Lok Adalat”, an alternative court mechanism for dispute, pending cases and pre-settlement cases, indefinitely.^[Calcutta High Court. March 19th, 2020. https://www.calcuttahighcourt.gov.in/Notice-Files/general-notice/2670] On March 24th, all courts in West Bengal closed from March 25th to April 9th.^[The Economic Times. March 24th, 2020. https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/calcutta-hc-district-courts-in-bengal-suspend-functioning-till-april-9-over-coronavirus/articleshow/74795597.cms] This court closure was extended to April 30th, then to May 15th, then to May 31st and finally until June 8th.^[Calcutta High Court. May 13th, 2020. https://calcuttahighcourt.gov.in/Notice-Files/general-notice/2760] ^[Calcutta High Court. May 28th, 2020. https://calcuttahighcourt.gov.in/Notice-Files/general-notice/2781] ^[Calcutta High Court. June 5th, 2020. https://calcuttahighcourt.gov.in/Notice-Files/general-notice/2787] ^[Calcutta High Court. June 5th, 2020. https://calcuttahighcourt.gov.in/Notice-Files/general-notice/2790]  

By the first week of April, the West Bengal government had created a number of COVID-19 taskforces. A ‘Global Advisory Board for COVID Response Policy in West Bengal’, headed by 2019 Nobel laureate Dr Abhijit Banerjee, was declared on April 6th to develop a plan for the post COVID-19 and lockdown situation.^[Nag, Jayatri. April 6th, 2020. Mumbai Mirror. https://mumbaimirror.indiatimes.com/coronavirus/news/west-bengal-government-to-form-global-advisory-board-for-covid-response-policy/articleshow/75013208.cms] On April 8th, the state announced three taskforces for restrictions and relaxations, enforcement as well as the economy respectively.^[Outlook India. April 8th, 2020. https://www.outlookindia.com/newsscroll/bengal-forms-three-task-forces-to-bolster-fight-against-covid19/1795766] The state-mandated restrictions on public movements from 7pm to 7am were announced on May 18th.^[Times of India. May 19th, 2020. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/west-bengal-total-lockdown-from-7pm-7am-but-wont-impose-curfew-on-people-says-cm-mamata-banerjee/articleshow/75819465.cms] Within 20 days, these restrictions were eased and were imposed from 9pm to 5am on June 4th.^[Ananya Varma. Republic World. June 4th, 2020. https://www.republicworld.com/india-news/general-news/west-bengal-movement-of-individuals-from-9pm-5am-prohibited.html] The new set of restrictions was again eased on June 26th. The latest restrictions were set from 10pm to 5am and were to remain in place until July 31st.^[Mehta, Puja. June 26th, 2020.
